Description: Devices for stabilizing vessels (e.g., keels, centerboards, outriggers)

Name: Cabins on board vessels
Description: Cabins on board vessels

Name: Decked vessels
Description: Decked vessels, with cabin or storage space below decks

Name: Merchant vessels
Description: Merchant vessels, operated by professional merchants and specially designed to transport cargo

Name: Navy
Description: Navy: fleet of specially designed warships maintained by the political unit

Name: Professional naval officers
Description: Professional naval officers

Name: Professional boat builders
Description: Professional boat builders (including part-time specialists)

Name: Dryd docks
Description: Dryd docks: permanent structures used during the construction and repair of vessels

Name: Professional sailors, pilots, or navigators
Description: Professional sailors, pilots, or navigators (including part-time specialists)

Name: Professional boatmen or ferrymen
Description: Professional boatmen, who earn a living ferrying passengers or goods over short distances

Name: Voyages undertaken out of sight of land
Description: Voyages undertaken out of sight of land

Name: Canals built for navigation
Description: Canals built for navigation

Name: Mnemonic devices for recording traditions, events, etc.
Description: Traditions, events, etc., recorded by means of mnemonic devices (including writing, but excluding simple methods of recording elapsed time, events, or simple inventories)

Name: System of writing
Description: System of writing (including extensive systems of standardized pictographs)

Name: Essentially phonetic system of writing
Description: Essentially phonetic system of writing

Name: Scribes, secretaries, or clerks
Description: Scribes, secretaries, or clerks (other than priests)

Name: Teachers
Description: Teachers: professional instructors, secular or religious, who are paid for their services and who instruct others than candidates for the priesthood

Name: Schools for secular subjects or vocational training
Description: Schools for instruction in secular (i.e., nonreligious) subjects or for vocational training (including, e.g., school for brides)

Name: Literacy general among the upper classes
Description: Literacy general among the upper classes (not merely among scribes and priests)

Name: Public primary schools
Description: Public primary schools

Name: Secular professional schools
Description: Secular professional schools (e.g., for the study of law, accounting, medicine, grammar)

Name: Literature
Description: Literature: speculative, esthetic, or historical writing as distinct from official records

Name: Epic verse
Description: Epic verse (excluding songs)

Name: Philosophy
Description: Philosophy: a system of beliefs about manÂ’s place in the world and about human conduct based on independent speculation and representing a departure from the prevailing or previously established system of beliefs

Name: Technical treatises or manuals
Description: Technical treatises or manuals (e.g., on medicine, pharmacy, divination, agriculture, metalworking)

Name: Standardized weights and measures
Description: Standardized weights and measures (excluding measurement with parts of the body, and similarly variable measurements)

Name: System of numbers extending beyond 100
Description: System of numbers extending beyond 100

Name: Mathematics
Description: Mathematics (beyond simple arithmetic)

Name: Techniques of surveying and mensuration
Description: Techniques of surveying and mensuration (including, e.g., plumb lines, knowledge of right angle, stretched cords, but excluding the swinging of circles by means of a cord)

Name: Regular astronomical observations by specialists
Description: Astronomical observations regularly made by priests or other specialists

Name: Calendrical system
Description: Calendrical system, uniquely designating each day of the year

Name: Calendrically fixed celebrations or religious observances
Description: Calendrically fixed days of celebration or religious observance recurring annually

Name: Regular schedule of work and rest beyond daily routine
Description: Regular schedule of work and rest other than daily routine (e.g., one day off every five)

Name: Musical instruments
Description: Musical instruments (excluding whistles)

Name: Games of calculation
Description: Games of calculation

Name: Team athletic contests
Description: Team athletic contests in which there is coordination among the members of each side

Name: Professional athletes
Description: Professional athletes (e.g., gladiators, ballplayers, acrobats)

Name: Professional bards, musicians, or storytellers
Description: Bards, minstrels, musicians, or storytellers, whose primary activity is to compose, play, or recite songs, poems, or stories

Name: Professional dancers or musicians
Description: Professional dancers or musicians

Name: Professional comic entertainers
Description: Professional comic entertainers (e.g,, clowns, buffoons, jesters, dwarfs)

Name: Troupes of professional actors
Description: Troupes of professional actors

Name: Fermented beverages from cultivated plants
Description: Fermented beverages brewed from cultivated plants

Name: Midwives, wet nurses, or foster nurses
Description: Midwives, wet nurses, or foster nurses who are regularly called upon and paid for their services

Name: Physicians
Description: Physicians: specialists who treat patients primarily by rational (i.e., non-supernaturalistic) means

Name: Surgery practiced
Description: Surgery practiced (excluding, e.g., the setting of broken bones, removal of arrows, bloodletting)

Name: Papermaking
Description: Papermaking (including the making of papyrus, parchment, or vellum)

Name: Zoos
Description: Zoos or menageries in which a wide variety of wild animals are kept as curiosities
